text: The Royal Garden () is an Italian Renaissance garden, situated in Prague Castle, and created around 1540 based on the project by Emperor Ferdinand I of Habsburg. Its site was originally a vineyard that Emperor Ferdinand I purchased to create a garden for the royal court. The garden was founded simultaneously with the Queen Anne's Summer Palace, which was completed in 1560. == Gallery == File:Pražský hrad, Oranžérie 01.jpg|Orangery File:Prague (3411113936).jpg|View File:Benešova vila v Královské zahradě.jpg|Villa of the president File:Průčelí Míčovny Pražského hradu.jpg|Real tennis room File:Hrad-6.jpg|View of the fountain at St. Vitus Cathedral File:Zpívající fontána.jpg|Singing fountain File:Oranžérie, Královská zahrada.jpg|Inside the Orangery File:Pražský hrad, Míčovna, socha 01.jpg|Allegory of night – baroque sculpture by M.B. title: Royal Garden of Prague Castle
